document_title: Pork tapeworm disease: Signs, causes, treatment, prevention
subsection_content:
Pork tapeworm disease is often caused by poor control of animal husbandry environment and food hygiene such as (2):
Directly eating food or drinking water contaminated with tapeworm eggs from infected human or pig feces.; Eat rare, raw, undercooked pork, raw spring rolls; Eating raw vegetables that have not been washed, containing eggs of pig string cyst larvae; The management and use of toilets is not hygienic; Raising pigs freely, without disease control and management; Not cleaning hands and feet after contact with potentially infectious environments such as soil, pig pens, toilets, etc.
subsection_title: benh san day lon.json. Cause of pork tapeworm disease
